KIDNEY PATIENTS IN MATALE DISTRICT: HEALTH

asked the Minister of Health: (a) Will he inform this House - (i) the number of patients with kidney disease reported from the Matale District from 2015 to date in relation to each year, separately; (ii) health centres in the Matale District to treat the patients with kidney disease; and (iii) steps that would be taken to enhance the facilities of those centers?
(b) If not, why? ( ( ) - ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Ramesh Pathirana - Minister of Industries and Minister of Health) , .
( ( ) ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Ramesh Pathirana) , - Chronic Kidney Disease of Unknown Origin - . . . 45 24 . . , .
( () ) (The Hon. (Mrs.) Rohini Kumari Wijerathna) . , . , , . . . " " . 8 . 2020 NVQ Level 3 . . , ? . GCE (O/L) 6 , 332 . . 8 . , . GCE (O/L) 6 , 332 .
( ) (The Hon. Rauff Hakeem, Attorney-at-Law) Thank you.

Hon. Speaker, I would like to tell the Hon. Minister of Health that todays newspapers have given publicity to the imminent danger of an epidemic called Mpox spreading in some countries, which might perhaps be elevated to a pandemic by the WHO depending on its spread. With this situation, I would like to inform the Hon. Minister that I have written a letter to your Secretary
and I am tabling* that. If there would be another pandemic, there are concerns expressed by minority communities, particularly by the Muslims.

Last time during the COVID-19 epidemic, there was forced cremation of victims as suggested by an expert committee, implementing an unscientific, racist policy. And later, your Government apologized for it and we appreciate that. But still, no departmental inquiry has been conducted against that expert committee for having taken that unscientific decision or for having arrived at such a horrendous decision without any foundation, which caused serious trauma for the entire Muslim community in this country.

Now, my concern is this, Hon. Minister. I have copied to you that letter with the heading Concerns over the imminent appointment of the Chief Epidemiologist, Ministry of Health, which I tabled earlier. A member of that particular expert committee, which gave that unscientific proposal to cremate COVID victims, who had been in the Philippines has now come here and you are making him the Acting Chief Epidemiologist. Undoubtedly, he may be elevated to that position. Our community and other communities which had been impacted on and had been worried about this situation have now raised this issue. I am asking you, Hon. Minister, that they be subjected to, at least, a departmental inquiry for having taken that unscientific decision. This particular gentleman who has come from the Philippines, Dr. Hasitha Tissera, is being appointed to an acting position at this time while there are allegations against him. Publicly, the Government has apologized for taking that decision. Therefore, I request that that appointment be stopped.

Then, there are also others. Today, it has been reported in the newspapers that another member of that expert committee called Dr. Ruwanpura, JMO of the Karapitiya Teaching Hospital, has spoken about legalizing abortion. These people are taking all kinds of new stands now, whereas they had, without any basis, taken that unscientific decision which caused serious impact on the Muslim community in this country. Therefore, I am requesting you, Hon. Minister, since your Government has apologized for that decision, please take action not to appoint such officials to such important positions, particularly if there is a pandemic once again. Our community is seriously worried about this issue.

( ( ) ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Ramesh Pathirana) Hon. Speaker, pandemic preparedness from the side of the Ministry of Health, I think, is much better now than yesteryear. We have taken all the necessary measures to ensure that people would not suffer, as indicated by the Hon. Rauff Hakeem. Also, I must mention categorically the fact that most of the appointments and also the

promotions have taken place as per the instructions of the Public Service Commission and also that there is no political interference as such. But, I will surely look into the concerns raised by the Hon. Rauff Hakeem regarding that matter.
Thank you. ( ) (The Hon. Speaker) Question No. 2 - 1920/2024 - (1), the Hon. (Mrs.) Rajika Wickramasinghe. - [Not in the Chamber.]
( ( ) ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Kavinda Heshan Jayawardhana) Hon. Speaker, - ( ) (The Hon. Speaker) Yes, Hon. Kavinda Heshan Jayawardhana? ( ( ) ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Kavinda Heshan Jayawardhana) , . . . . .

: SRI LANKA SOCIAL SECURITY BOARD: PENSION AND
( - () ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. (Mrs.) Rajika Wickramasinghe) , - (1
() , ? asked the Minister of Women, Child Affairs and Social Empowerment:

(i) the total number of beneficiaries entitled to pension and social security benefits executed by the Sri Lanka Social Security Board; (ii) the professions eligible to get the membership of the said schemes; (iii) the number of annual registrations of the said schemes; (iv) the annual benefits gained by the said members, separately; and (v) the actions that have been taken to get new members registered for the said schemes?
(b) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Prasanna Ranatunga) , , * .
( - .. ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon.U.K. Sumith Udukumbura) - (1
asked the Minister of Transport and Highways:
(i) the total length of the railway tracks in Sri Lanka in kilometres;
(ii) separately, the total number of locomotives and carriages that are in operation at present;
(iii) whether the railway carriages and the locomotives that were imported from India in the past have been put into operation at present; and
(iv) if not, the reasons for not putting them into operation?
(b) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Prasanna Ranatunga) , * .
WATER SHORTAGE IN SOUTH-EASTERN PLAINS: SOLUTIONS
( - ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Vasudeva Nanayakkara) - (2

(i) whether he is aware that cultivated lands in many regions of the south-eastern plains including Hambantota, the Udawalawa Region, the Kirama Oya Region and the Malalaara Region have been destroyed due to the severe drought;

(ii) whether steps will be taken to implement the two solutions proposed by the "Surakimu Ruhuna" organization such as streamlining the old irrigation conservation system and diverting excess water from the wet zone to the above areas (Kalu Ganga Diversion Project);
(iii) if not, what are the immediate measures expected to be implemented to avoid the water shortage in the above-mentioned regions; and
(iv) whether steps will be taken to start the Gin and Nilwala River projects that have been currently halted?
(b) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Prasanna Ranatunga) , * .
: INCREASE OF PADDY PRODUCTION IN BATTICALOA
) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Shanakiyan Rajaputhiran Rasamanickam) - (1
asked the Minister of Agriculture and Plantation Industries:

(a) Will he inform this House - (i) the total extent of paddy lands in Batticaloa District, in acres; (ii) the extent of lands that can be cultivated only for one season, for two seasons and for three seasons of the year, separately; (iii) whether there are plans to increase paddy production in aforesaid lands; and (iv) if so, aforesaid plans?
(b) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Prasanna Ranatunga) , * .
CHILD CARE CENTRES IN ESTATES: STANDARDS AND
) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Velu
asked the Minister of Water Supply and Estate Infrastructure Development:
(i) whether he is aware that child care centres (crches) have been established in estates for mothers to leave their children under care when they go to work;
(ii) the age limit of children who are admitted to such centres; and
(iii) how many children are looked after at these centres at present?
(b) Will he also inform this House -
(i) the qualifications that caretakers in charge of afore-mentioned centres should possess;
(ii) the standards and regulations that should be followed in operating such centres; and
(iii) whether steps will be taken to formulate standards and regulations, if such are not available?
(c) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Prasanna Ranatunga) , *

SRI LANKA CEMENT CORPORATION: AGREEMENT WITH
asked the Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies:

(a) Will he inform this House of the reasons and methods by which Sri Lanka Cement Corporation (SLCC) entered into an agreement with Asha Minerals (Pvt.) Ltd. for exploration and development violating the Mines and Minerals Act, the Intellectual Property Act and the fundamental rights of Puttalam Ilmenite Limited (PIL), which possessed required licenses long before Asha Minerals (Pvt.) Ltd.?
(b) Will he also inform this House of the-
(i) reasons for not taking action on the letter dated 23.05.2023 of the Ministry of Industries;
(ii) outcome of the appeal of PIL forwarded to the Ministry of Finance on 19.10.2023;
(iii) reasons for not following the instructions given to the SLCC by the Ministry of Finance on 30.01.2024 and 11.03.2024 respectively; and
(iv) manner in which compliance is enforced on SLCC by the Line Ministry and the Treasury, as the sole shareholder of it?
( - , ) (The Hon. Ranil Wickremesinghe - President, Minister of Defence and Minister of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies)

(a) It is observed in the examination of previous files that the agreement entered into by the Sri Lanka Cement Corporation with Asha Minerals (Pvt.) Ltd. was an agreement entered into without the consent/awareness of the Ministry of Industry, which was the Line Ministry at that time. Therefore, information was sought from the

Chairman of the Cement Corporation regarding the reasons and methods for entering into the said agreement and the said information was included in the Chairman's letter dated 05.08.2024 submitted as Annexure 01*.

Furthermore, even if it is stated in the letter of the Chairman of the Cement Corporation dated 05.08.2024 that the Sri Lanka Cement Corporation was informed by the Ministry of Industry by its letter dated 23.11.2022 to provide necessary facilities to Asha Minerals (Pvt.) Ltd. to extract the Puttalam ilmenite deposit, it is observed that the letter dated 23.11. 2022 of the Secretary of the Ministry of Industry submitted as Annexure 02* only states "A request made by Asha Minerals (Pvt.) Ltd. for obtaining samples is referred to the Sri Lanka Cement Corporation for further work".
(b) (i) The relevant letter is a letter addressed to the Secretary to the President by the Secretary of the Ministry of Industry, which was the Line Ministry at that time.
(ii) As per the appeal dated 19.10.2023 sent by

the Puttalam Ilmenite Limited to the Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies, the relevant parties have been convened and given necessary recommendations on 30.01.2024 and 11.03.2024. The discussion notes containing the decisions reached and recommendations made at those discussions have been forwarded in writing to the Sri Lanka Cement Corporation on 05.02.2024 and 25.03.2024, respectively.

(iii) It is stated in the letter dated 05.08.2024 (Annexure 01) of the Chairman of Sri Lanka Cement Corporation that as per the instructions given by the Ministry of Finance, Economic Stabilization and National Policies to the Sri Lanka Cement Corporation on 30.01.2024 and 11.03.2024 respectively, the approval of the Board of Directors of Sri Lanka Cement Corporation had not been given "for handing over the Aruwakkalu limestone quarry owned by the Sri Lanka Cement Corporation without making any payment to the owner of the land and in a way that makes it a disadvantage to the Corporation and the Government of Sri Lanka.

(iv) Sri Lanka Cement Corporation is an entity with legal personality incorporated under the State Industrial Corporations Act, No. 49 of 1957. The Board of Directors is responsible for the overall performance of all its operations, management and control.
Corrections which Members suggest for the Final Print should be clearly marked in their copy and sent to the Editor of HANSARD within two weeks
of receipt of the uncorrected copy.
